pageContext.description: This had 3 rivets at each side the 3rd. rivet is broken) & belongs to the upper portioni, nearest the handle, which with the guard, was in one piece in this this type & quite plain.
pageContext.patina: some green patina on blade, the rest of blade is golden brown. Handle has little golden brown; part is worn off or cleaned off.
pageContext.site: England,Leicestershire,Welby,Probably from Gravel Hole Field, found by a farmer digging for gravel.,1895
pageContext.toSearch: Welby, Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire Le14, United Kingdom
pageContext.remarks: The hoard was taken to a foundry in Melton Mowbray whence a part was rescued by W.S. Barnes, Mrs.Hocart was his daughter.
